Understate: The claim underestimates the fact that Black Americans are killed at a much higher rate than white Americans.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support its assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of police shootings is the only relevant factor in assessing racial disparities in police violence, without considering other contextual factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the disparities in police shootings between white and Black Americans.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Black Americans are disproportionately killed by police, despite the data showing more white Americans being shot and killed.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the data showing more white Americans being shot and killed by police, without providing the necessary context.
